principle.name: Test Before Commit
principle.description: Always run the full test suite before committing any code changes.
principle.rationale: Prevents regressions and ensures code stability.

example.good: Run all tests and verify 100% pass rate

principle.name: Update Tests with Code Changes
principle.description: Update or add tests whenever code is modified, especially for new features or bug fixes.
principle.rationale: Ensures new logic is covered and prevents untested changes.

example.good: Add or update tests for all new behaviors
example.bad: Leave old tests unchanged after refactor

principle.name: Isolate Test Failures
principle.description: Investigate and resolve any failing tests before proceeding.
principle.rationale: Unresolved failures may hide new issues or regressions.

example.good: Fix the test or the code before continuing
example.bad: Ignore the failure and continue development

convention.rule: Name test files and functions clearly to reflect what they validate.
Organize tests by feature or module for clarity and maintainability.
convention.template: # Example: Place tests in a __tests__ directory or use *.test.* naming

pitfall.description: Skipping tests to speed up commits
pitfall.why_problematic: Allows undetected bugs and regressions into mainline code.
pitfall.correct_approach: Always run all tests before commit, even for small changes.

pitfall.description: Not updating tests after code changes
pitfall.why_problematic: Leads to outdated or misleading test coverage.
pitfall.correct_approach: Review and update tests with every code change.

category.name: before_starting
category.item: Review code changes and affected features

category.name: during_implementation
category.item: Write or update tests for all new/changed logic

category.name: before_completion
category.item: Confirm no regressions or breaking changes
